page.title: 09HEALTH
page.content: Bramcote hospital school is for mentally handicapped and emotionally disturbed children aged from 4 to 16 years. They come from the Coventry, Bedworth, Rugby and Nuneaton areas. Most of the mentally handicapped live there or go home at weekends. Many of the emotionally disturbed travel to school daily. They stay for just a few months.There are nurses and helpers to look after the children. The school has one full -time teacher, one part time and two helpers. It opens from 9 o'clock to 3.15 p.m. In the mentally handicapped room there are big mats and lots of toys. The children who can, do swimming, horse-riding, running, football and general exercise. They have music, art, and other lessons. When it opened in 1965 there were 20 pupils.
